comment: PhotovoltaicMeasurement schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.GreenEnergy/master/PhotovoltaicMeasurement/schema.json
description: The Data Model is intended to measure the continuous power transferred by the photo-voltaic panel to an Inverter Device.

contents.name: activePower
contents.comment: Active Power,where phi is the phase shift of the current compared to the voltage. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes (max 3 characters). For instance, For instance, **KWT** represents Kilowatt

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: current
contents.comment: Electrical intensity of the current. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **AMP** represents Ampere

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateEnergyMeteringStarted
contents.comment: The starting date for metering energy in an ISO8601 UTC format

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateObservedFrom
contents.comment: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted

contents.name: dateObservedTo
contents.comment: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved' attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted

contents.name: nominalPeakPowerGeneration
contents.comment: nominalPeakPowerGeneration is a number. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **KWT** represents Kilowatt

contents.name: reactivePower
contents.comment: Reactive Power used by circuits. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **K5** represents kilovolt-ampere-reactive

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: temperature
contents.comment: Temperature recorded at the time of Observation compared to the  nominal reference temperature of the device. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CEL** represents Degree Celsius

contents.name: inverterStatus

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
